channel.title: Talks By S. Dilworth Young
channel.description: General Conference talks by S. Dilworth Young.

image.title: General Conference talks by S. Dilworth Young.

item.title: “When Thou Art Converted”
item.description: “… and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.” So said the Lord to Peter as he prepared himself and his apostles for his great sacrifice. This statement might have startled Peter. Certainly it pricked him, for he said, “Lord, I am ready to

item.title: “By Love, Serve One Another”
item.description: It is my desire to be led by the Spirit of the Lord in what I say. The wards and branches of the Church have been organized to give activity to a large number of the members, the great majority actually. Yet there are many with no official position o

item.title: Missionary Training Begins Early
item.description: In my mind’s eye I see Russell Nelson, Jr., newly arrived from his home in heaven and staring up into the eyes of his father as though to say to him (as Joseph Smith said to Newel K. Whitney), “You prayed me here; now what do you want of me?”

item.title: “Having Been Born of Goodly Parents”
item.description: While we realize that we shall have close association with Elder Bruce R. McConkie in our future work with the missions of the Church and shall partake of his wisdom and spirituality, we also know that we shall miss him more than any of us care to ad

item.title: When I Read, I Am There
item.description: When I decided to choose a subject for this moment, I discovered I did not have enough words in the English language to properly express my true feelings, but it is the only language I know and so I shall have to use them and hope that the prayer of

item.title: The Witnesses of Christ
item.description: In about the year . 30 there came to the banks of the River Jordan a man—young, strong, and rustic in appearance. He began to baptize people, but he was not like others who were baptizing in Jordan; and there were others, for they baptized only to br

item.title: That the Scriptures Might Be Fulfilled
item.description: One who reads through the books of Matthew and John finds in them not only the account of the life of the Lord Jesus Christ and the story of the establishment of his kingdom on earth, but the evidences that he fulfilled the prophecies concerning the

item.title: “For Thy Servant Heareth”
item.description: I shall speak about boys who have just started into adolescence.

item.title: Scouters: Lead Them to a Mission
item.description: President Milton R. Hunter has been in Hawaii for several weeks gaining strength after a long illness. He came home a week or so ago with the hope that he could attend this conference. This one has particular meaning for him, for it marks a long peri

item.title: The Still Small Voice
item.description: We welcome the four new members of the First Quorum of the Seventy and assure them of our love, our complete sustaining and acceptance of their appointments, and shall do our best to be cooperative with them in their work.

item.title: “I Have Gained”
item.description: A week or so ago I wrote an address which I thought I might give at this conference, but the events of the past two days have made that a little inconvenient. So I thought perhaps I ought to begin by apologizing to the translators who have to change

item.title: “He Hath Showed Thee, O Man, What Is Good”
item.description: I shall begin by bearing a testimony. I am certain and bear the witness, by applying the principle just stated by Brother McConkie, that the calling which has come to me and my colleagues in the last two days is as much the inspiration of the Lord as
